title: My Literature
clickText: Back in my day, we had no websites. Nay, we read books like real intellectuals.

entries.title: Lists in Programming
entries.description: Lists are an important concept in programming. A list is an ordered collection of objects. There are three main operations that can be performed on a list: adding elements; removing elements; accessing elements; modifying elements.

entries.title: Principles of Recursion
entries.description: Recursion is a strategy of solving problems that involves nested and repeated code, often through the use of functions. It is used to solve problems that contain smaller versions of themselves.

entries.title: Noncomparative Sorting
entries.description: Noncomparative sorting uses the properties of numbers to rearrange lists, making it more efficient than comparisons in certain cases.

entries.title: Object Oriented Programming
entries.description: Object-oriented programming has become the most popular programming paradigm in the last few years. By understanding its core concepts well, one can greatly improve their understanding of many languages.
